column1: IgG autoantibodies (present in 91% of cases) most commonly bind to rhesus antigen, marking them for haemolysis in the spleen, and leading to extravascular haemolysis.
Optimal binding of C3 and IgG occurs at the core body temperature of 37 degrees, thus the name ‘warm autoimmune haemolytic anaemia’.
More rarely, abnormal binding of C3 to erythrocytes also may lead to complement activation and intravascular haemolysis.

3,Haematology,,Prognosis,

Prognosis varies from early death due to end organ damage, to survival into the 60's to 70’s with effective treatment.
• In Africa, most children (up to 90%) will not make it to the age of 5.
• Most common cause of death in children is life-threatening infection.
• In adults, the most common causes of death include stroke, pulmonary hypertension, acute chest syndrome, and sepsis.
